User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0

Steps to reproduce:

On Windows (tested on XP Sp3 and Vista) with a Firefox 3.6.*  window active, press Win+D (Windows shortcut) to show desktop, and then press Win+D again to activate Firefox back


Actual results:

After the double Win+D with Firefox window active, no shortcut works. F5, Ctrl+T, Ctrl+W..etc, do nothing, until you manually click on a tab or a search bar control in order to activate them


Expected results:

Shortcuts should have just worked fine, no need to change your current tab or focus the search bar in order to make them work again.
